page.title: 02BRIGHTLINGSEA CHURCH
page.content: All Saints Church stands in the middle of an agricultural area and once held regular weekly services.However,with the local decline of agriculture, Brightlingsea became a sea-faring rather than a farming area and community activities became centred on the coast.Consequently the church fell into comparative neglect,and now is used only for special services. In 1969 the fabric of the church was in such poor condition that its permenant closure seemed inevitable. However "The Friends of All Saints Church" was founded and since then have raised over Â£20,000.The fabric of All Saints has been saved from further decay and a start made on long-term restoration.The Friends represent everyone in the local community and beyond,who wants to see this beautiful old church restored.
